projects.title: New build of Unilever Food Innovation Center (FIC) Wageningen
projects.description:
Arcadis is responsible for project management for the new construction of Unilever's Global Foods Innovation Centre. Within this team I provide technical consultation and advice for Unilever and its contractors.

Unilever's Global Foods Innovation Centre is a state of the art facility for healthier and sustainable food innovations. The building with high BREEAM ambitions fits in with the circular economy and is expected to open its doors in mid-2019.

The 18,000m2 Global Foods Innovation Centre consists of a Pilot Plant, a Food & Customer Experience and two floors of offices and laboratories. In the Pilot Plant, a mini factory, the pilot production of new products takes place in limited volumes. This Pilot Plant is linked to the Food & Customer Experience, where innovative ingredients and recipes for the development of new products are tested daily in various test kitchens. Employees, experts, students and consumers can get to know these innovations here or in the concept store and share their findings. Underneath the entire building is a parking garage that is accessible to both employees of Unilever and the University of Wageningen.

projects.title: University Utrecht High End Electron Microscopy Faclity - David de Wied building
projects.description:
For the realization of the facility Electron Microscopy and Intensification of David de Wied building as project leader within the design team responsible for the project and process control.
Given the complexity of the project, I was added to the team during the completion of the DO phase to set out the structure and process lines and to take care of communication with the client, architect and other stakeholders.

The David de Wied building (DdW) was completed in 2011. This building houses part of the Faculty of Science. The building (approx. 19,500 m2 GLA) consists largely of laboratories and also has office workplaces and teaching rooms. The building is currently used by various research groups from the departments of Chemistry and Pharmaceutical Sciences. 

The faculty of Science has the ambition to form a Life Sciences cluster (LSC) in the DdW. A number of groups of the Centre for Biomolecular Research will move to the DdW.
The building will remain in use during the execution. This means that the work must be carried out in phases.

For one of the research groups of the Bijvoet Centre (Cryo-electron Microscopy) additional, technically complex facilities for Electron Microscopy (EM) are required.
The project has the sustainability ambition of obtaining the certificate belonging to BREEAM-In-Use, level Excellent.

projects.title: New build R&D Center FrieslandCampina
projects.description:
Involved from the DO up to and including the tender phase in which the blueprint for the design of the new FrieslandCampina Innovation Center building was laid. Also responsible for inspection and supervision in the implementation phase. 

The new building will accommodate approximately 400 FrieslandCampina employees. They will have access to approximately 4,600 m2 of laboratories and taste testing rooms, a 2,500 m² pilot plant (techno hall), 3,800 m2 of facility rooms and 7,100 m2 of offices. The FrieslandCampina Innovation Centre also houses an Experience Centre with an innovative kitchen and test bakery, where visitors and employees of FrieslandCampina from all over the world can taste, smell and feel products in an inspiring environment. The design and building provide for a BREEAM "Very Good" certification.

Involved in the implementation of a new surveillance protocol via an application on the iPad, rolled out for FrieslandCampina's application as well as for other integrated large projects.

projects.title: Technical installations NVLU New build for traffic control at Utrecht station
projects.description:
Responsible for the mechanical design from the DO phase up to and including the tender phase. The design of the NVLU is characterized by an integral sustainable design. 
Integral sustainability means that both the structural application and the installation applications achieve synergy with regard to the sustainability of the building. 

The building is characterized by the application of triple glazing and a building envelope with an Rc of 5, an energy roof for the generation of cooling and electricity, hybrid cooling machines, the orientation of the building with horizontal blinds around the building that serve as fixed blinds, high efficiency ventilation system with special heat and moisture recovery accumulators for energy recovery, PV cells on carports etcetera. 
Total floor area of the building approximately 6000 m2.

projects.title: University of Groningen Faculty of Science and Engineering -  Feringa Building
projects.description:
For the new building of the Zernikeborg involved from the start in drawing up the TPvE. Subsequently as lead engineer responsible for the sketch design, preliminary design and final design. The project is currently in the TO phase.

The Zernikeborg will be the place for high-quality fundamental and applied research where top institutes will be housed. The dimensions are impressive: with over 62,000 m2, a total length of 260 meters and a width of 63 meters, this will be the largest building on the Zernike Campus Groningen. The new building will be five floors high with an installation layer for the air treatment plant on top. The building is intended for education and research for some 1,000 bachelor students, 450 master students and 840 employees. 

The Zernikeborg was designed on the basis of sustainable and earthquake-resistant design principles. Visible measures include the 1200 m2 of solar panels on top of the roof. Major efforts are also being made to save energy, for example by means of self-closing fume cupboards, connection to two sources for heat and cold storage (CHP) and the use of LED lighting in offices and laboratories.

projects.title: Central heating and cooling plant CS Amsterdam
projects.description:
For the entire station area, a new heating and cooling plant has been designed within the monumental contours of the station building. For the total energy requirement, 10 MW of heat and 9 MW of cold will be provided. 
During the realisation as supervisor/director, he was involved in this project. The emphasis was on the fact that everything took place within the existing contours of the building, while respecting its monumental character. The emphasis was also on supplying heat and cold on time to customers in connection with phases and contracts.
